servinfo.title: Diesel Particulate Filter Removal and Installation

attention1.ptxt: To avoid the danger of being burned, do not touch the exhaust system when the system is hot. Any service on the exhaust system should be performed when the system is cool.

attention2.ptxt: When replacing diesel particulate filter, perform “Initialize diesel PF data” mode of SUZUKI scan tool referring to “SUZUKI Tech 2 Operator's Manual”.

s1.ptxt: Remove exhaust gas temperature sensor 2 and 3 from diesel particulate filter.
Remove diesel particulate filter differential pressure sensor union nut.
Remove diesel particulate filter differential pressure sensor pipe from diesel particulate filter.

servinfosub.title: Installation
servinfosub.ptxt: Reverse removal procedure noting the following.

item.ptxt: Tighten bolts and nuts to specified torque referring to Exhaust System Components:F9Q .
When replacing diesel particulate filter, perform “Initialize diesel PF data” mode of SUZUKI scan tool referring to “SUZUKI Tech 2 Operator's Manual”.
